comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Shop is labelled Deasy, so I searched the 1911 census for "Deasy" with "shop" in occupation, 4 results. Checked Creagh, Skibberreen, too rural. Ballyhooley Road, Cork on the other hand: Dillon's Cross.

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Great Work, be careful with your note on that dog - it may be stuffed and not count..............

comment.author: 30687643@N00
comment._content: maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,568636,573041,7,9 taken when a camera brought everyone out on the street!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Half an hour, Niall? You're losing your touch! :D Have to say, I wasn't really seeing it at first from the angle on Street View, but once I looked at it from a few angles it looks spot on. Is this Ballyhooley Road the road that leads to our Ballyhooly?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: The Street View overlay on this one was so good that I have taken the liberty (under the Flickr Commons license) of adding this image to my Historypin channel - see www.historypin.com/map/#!/geo:51.908987,-8.455156/zoom:11... (use the fader bar at the bottom)

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/whatsthatpicture] No "liberty" at all, James, delighted with the effect! Added your link into the description above...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] thanks [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] what a lovely way to describe it [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] glad you like it. For those who are interested in maps and old pictures, from www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland/map/ you can see NLI currently have 769 geotagged images. A better way of looking at these is to see them in Google Earth, which you can do via www.whatsthatpicture.com/flickr/commons.kml?owner=4729094... (you'll have to have Google Earth installed first). Carol, I have written an automatic export/import tool to bulk transfer images from Flickr to Historypin if you're interested in setting up a channel? They'd look fantastic, and I'm happy to give you a hand.
